juzs.text: And We did not send down upon his people any army from heaven, after him, nor did We need send any
It was just a single deafening blast, and then they were silenced by death
Alas for the subjects! Never does a Messenger come to them but they mock him
Do they not see how many generations We did destroy before them — generations that return to them not
And all of them, certainly indeed, will be brought before Us together
And a sign to them is the dead earth. We make it alive, and bring out from it grain of which they eat
And We have made therein gardens of date-palms and grapes and We have made some springs to flow therein
That they may eat of the fruit thereof — fruit that their hands have not made. Will they not then be thankful
Glory to Him Who created pairs of all things — pairs of what the earth grows, pairs of their own kind, and pairs of what they know not
And a sign to them is the night: We take out the day therefrom and then they are those in darkness
And the sun moves on in the way (orbit) fixed for it. That is a course laid down by the Omnipotent, the Knowledgeable
And the moon: We have laid down phases for it till it returns in shape (curved) to an old dry palm-stalk
Neither is it possible for the sun to overtake the moon (for their paths are different), nor can the night take the place of the day. And all float on in orbit
And a sign to them is that We bore their race in the laden ship (Noah's Ark)
And We have created for them the like thereof, whereon they ride
And if We so will, We may drown them, then there would be no one to respond to their cries for help, nor can they be rescued
(They cannot be rescued) except by mercy and provision from Us for a given time
And then it would be said to them, "Take heed of what is ahead of you and what is behind you, so that mercy is shown to you
And there comes to them no Verse of the Verses of their Lord but they turn away from it

And when it is said to them, "Spend out of what Allah has given you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Shall we feed him whom, if Allah wills, He could feed? You are not but clearly in error
And they say, "When will this promise (of the Last Day happening) come to pass, if what you say is true
They await but a single deafening blast, which will overwhelm them while they squabble
Then they will not be able to make a bequest, nor return to their families
And when the trumpet is blown, to their Lord they will rush from their graves
They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our graves? This is what the Gracious One had promised! And the Messengers did tell the truth
It will but be a single dafening blast, after which they all shall be brought before Us
That Day then none shall be wronged even a bit; and you shall not be recompensed aught but for what you did
The inhabitants of the Garden (Paradise) shall indeed on that Day be merrily occupied
They and their wives shall be in shaded places, reclining on couches
They shall have fruits therein, and they shall have whatever they desire
Peace shall be the greeting from the Merciful Lord
And stand aside this Day, O guilty ones
Did I not send guidance to you, O children of Adam, that you should not worship the Satan? He is indeed an open enemy to you
And that you worship Me. This is the Straight Path
And he (Satan) did certainly lead many a generation from among you astray. Could you not then understand
This is the Hell you were being warned of
Suffer it this Day since you suppressed the Truth
This Day We seal their mouths and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will bear witness as to what they earned
And had We so willed, We would have covered their eyes. Then, how would they see to get to the (Straight) Path
And had We so willed, We would have degraded them in their position, then they would be able neither to proceed, nor turn back
And one whom We give a long life, We cause a reversal of creation in that one. Do they not understand
And We have not taught him (Prophet Muhammad) poetry, nor does it befit him. This (Qur'aan) is nothing but a clear Narrative and Reading
(The Qur'aan is meant) to warn him who is alive, and to expose those that suppress the Truth therein
Do they not see that We have created — of things Our hands have wrought — cattle for them, so they become their masters
And We have made the cattle subservient to them, so some of them they ride, and some they eat
And for them therein there are other benefits, and they get milk therefrom to drink. Will they not then be grateful
And they take gods besides Allah hoping to be helped
They (gods other than Allah) are incapable of helping them, and yet they (the polytheists) consider them (the gods) a host at their beck and call
So let not what they say grieve you. We do indeed know what they conceal and what they proclaim
Does not man see that We have created him from a little thing of fertilized ovum? And, lo, he has become an open adversary
And he (man) compares us to material things and forgets his own creation. He says, "Who will bring the bones to life, when they are rotten
Say, "He will bring life back to them, Who had brought them into existence in the first place. And He knows the entire creation
He Who makes fire for you out of the green tree, the fire with which then you kindle
Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth capable of creating the like thereof? Yes, of course! And He is the Creator, fully aware of all things
When He intends anything, His command to it is just to say, "Be", and it is
Glory then to Him in Whose hand is the sovereignty over all things! And to Him is your return
By those that line up in rows
And then charge fiercely (at the enemy)
Reciting Allah's Greatness (Allaho-akbar)
Indeed! There is only One Entity Whom you should worship
(And the One Whom you should worship is the) Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is in between, and Lord of the easts
We have indeed adorned the sky of this world with the glitter of the stars
And We have made it (the sky of this world) a safeguard against every defiant devil
They cannot listen to the deliberations of the Highest Assembly up there. And they are repelled from every side
They (the defiant devils) are driven off. And for them is perpetual punishment
In the exceptional case of a devil snatching away any secret, a piercing flame trails him
Ask them then whether what they have created was more difficult or what We have created. We have indeed created them of clinging clay
Nay! You wonder, while they mock
And when reminded, they take no heed
And when they see a (miraculous) sign (like Moses' staff turning into serpent), they mock at it
And say, "This is nothing but obvious magic
When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be raised to life again
We or our fore-fathers
Say, "Yes! And you will be humble
And it will but be one big shout, and then they will see
And they will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment
This is the Day of Distinction (of those going to Paradise from those going to Hell), which you used to deny
Gather all those who wronged (themselves and others) and their associates, and what they worshipped
Besides Allah, and then lead them up the way to Hell
And stop them there to be questioned
What is the matter with you that you help not one another
Nay! That day they will be submissive
And they will confront one another questioningly
Saying, "You did indeed use to come to us from the right side (exercise control over us)
The others will say, "Nay! You (yourselves) were not believers
And we had no authority over you, but you (yourselves) were a transgressing people
And the word of our Lord has come true over us: we do indeed have to taste it
We led you astray, for we ourselves had gone astray
So, that Day they will share the punishment
Thus do We deal with the criminals
They had indeed behaved arrogantly, when they were told, "There is no god but Allah
And they had said, "Shall we abandon our gods for the sake of a mad poet
Nay, he has come with the Truth and confirms what the Messengers (had come with before)
You shall indeed taste the painful punishment
And you shall be paid back nothing but for what you did
Save those who worship Allah alone devotedly
For them is sustenance as expected
Of fruits. And they are honoured
In Gardens of bliss
On couches, facing one another
A bowl of pure original drink will be made to go around them
White in colour, delicious in taste
There will be nothing destructive in it, nor will they get intoxicated therewith
And with them will there be those with restraining looks from beautiful eyes
As if they were eggs, carefully shielded
Some of them will then accost others inquisitively
One of them will say, "I used to have a companion
Who asked, `Are you indeed of those who accept
When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be brought to justice
Another (person in Paradise) will say, "Will you have a look
Then he looked down and saw him (companion on earth of the man in Paradise) in the ignominy of Hell
He will say, "By Allah! You had almost ruined me
And had it not been for the largesse of my Lord, I should have been among those brought there
Are we to have no death
Except for our previous death!? And are we not to be punished
This indeed is the highest success
For the like of this, then, let the people do their work
Is this better as hospitable reception or Zaqqum, the tree of Hell
We have indeed made it [Zaqqum] a calamity for the wicked people
It is a tree that springs up at the bottom of Hell
Its shoots repulsive as devils' heads
Then indeed they will eat therefrom and fill their bellies therewith
Then indeed for them thereupon will there be a drink made of boiling water. a
Then indeed their return shall be to the Hell
They indeed had found their fathers astray
So they hasten to follow in their (fathers') footsteps
And most of the ancient peoples did go astray before them
And We did send warners among them
Then see what end those warned met with
Except for those who devotedly worship Allah alone
And Noah did certainly call out to Us, and how excellent was our response
And We saved him and the people with him from the great grief
And made his offspring the only survivors
And left on him [the salutation] among the later generations
Peace on Noah among the worlds
Thus indeed do We reward the good people
He was indeed one of Our believing worshippers
We then drowned the others
And, indeed, Abraham was of his ilk
When he came to his Lord with a sound mind
When he said to his father and his people, "What is it that you worship
Do you desire to perpetrate the lie that there are gods besides Allah
What do you then think about the Lord of all the worlds
He then cast a glance at the stars
And said, "I am sick indeed
So they turned away from him
Then he secretly turned to their gods and asked them, "Don't you eat
What is the matter with you that you do not speak
Then, unseen by anyone, he turned upon them, hitting them with his right hand
Then they (the people) came rushing to him
He (Abraham) asked, "Do you worship that which you (yourselves) carve out
And Allah has created you and your work
They (the people) said, "Cast him (Abraham) into the flaming fire from a structure specially built for him
And they devised a plan against him, but We brought them down
And he (Abraham) said, "I do indeed betake myself to my Lord — He will guide me
My Lord, grant me a righteous son
So We gave him the good news of a gentle and kind son

And then when he (son) grew up to be able to work with him, he (Abraham) said, "O my son! I have seen in a dream that I sacrifice you. Now consider how you see it." He (son) said, "O my father! Act upon what is commanded to you. Allah willing, you will find me patient
And then when they had both submitted to Allah's Will, and he (Abraham) had laid him (son) upon his forehead
And We called out to him, "O Abraham
You have certainly fulfilled the obligation laid upon you in the vision. We do thus reward the good people
This is indeed the trial manifest
And We ransomed him (Abraham) with a great sacrifice
And left on him [the salutation] among the later generations
Peace upon Abraham
We do thus reward the good people
He was indeed one of Our believing worshippers
And We gave him the good news of (his son) Isaac, (who would also be) a prophet from among the righteous people
And We bestowed blessings on him and on Isaac. And of their offspring some have been good, but some, evidently unjust to themselves
And We did certainly confer a favour on Moses and Aaron
And We saved them both and their people from the great grief
And We helped them, and then they were the ones with the upper hand
And We gave them both the Book (Torah) that made things clear
And We guided them on the Straight Path
And left on them both [the salutation] among the later generations
Peace upon Moses and Aaron
Thus do We indeed reward the good people
They both were indeed among Our believing subjects
And Elias (Elijah) was indeed among those sent as Messengers
When he asked his people, "Are you not scared of wrongful living
Do you pray to Ba'l (idol worshipped by Elias' people) and forsake the Best of the creators —
— Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers
But they rejected him (Elias), so they shall indeed certainly be presented (for punishment before the Lord)
Excpt for those who worship Allah alone devotedly
And We left on him [the salutation] among the later generations
Peace upon Elias
We do indeed thus reward the good people
He was indeed among Our believing subjects
And Lot was certainly indeed one of those sent as Allah's Messengers
When We saved him and his family, all —
Except for an old woman who was left among those who remained behind
Then We destroyed the others [— other than those saved]
And you do indeed pass by them in the mornings
And at night. Do you not then understand
And Jonah was certainly indeed one of those sent as Allah's Messengers
When he ran away to the laden ship
And then he (Jonas) embarked the ship with others but was one of those thrown overboard (into the sea)
And then the big fish swallowed him and he was himself to blame
But had he not indeed been of those who glorify (Allah)
He would have remained in its belly till the Day people are resurrected
Then We flung him on to the open shore, and he was sick
And We caused a gourd vine to grow up over him
And We sent him to a constituency of a hundred thousand or more
And they believed, so We let them enjoy life for a while
Now ask them (your people, O Muhammad) whether your Lord has daughters and they would like to have sons for themselves
Did We create the angels as females, and did they witness their creation
Are they not just telling some of the lies they have themselves concocted
And (they say), "Allah has children." And they certainly are liars
Has He preferred to have daughters over sons
What is the matter with you? How poorly do you judge
Would you not yet take heed
Or, do you have any clear authority
Then produce your document, if what you say is true
And they assume a relationship between Him and the jinn. And the jinn do certainly know that they will be brought up for judgment
Allah is far more glorious than how they describe Him
Except for those who devotedly worship Allah alone
So you indeed and what you worship
Are incapable of tempting anyone against Him
Save him who is destined to burn in the flaming Fire
And there is none of us (Angels) but has an assigned place
And we are indeed those ranged in ranks
And we do indeed certainly glorify Him
And they did indeed use to say
If only we had a scripture from the ancestors
We would have devotedly worshipped Allah alone
And so they now disbelieve in it (the Qur'aan), and so they will soon come to know
And Our word has certainly already gone forth to those of Our subjects sent as the Messengers
That they indeed are surely those who shall be helped
And, indeed, Ours will be the triumphant army
So turn away from them for a while
And observe them, they too will observe
Would they want Our punishment hastened
It will be a bad day for those who wait for the punishment, as it would descend in their yard
And turn away from them for a while
And observe, they too will observe
Your Lord, the Lord of Majesty, is far more glorified than how they describe Him
And peace on those sent as Messengers
And praise to Allah, the Lord of the worlds
Sad. By this Qur'an, that contains all that one should remember and all that matters
But, verily, the suppressors of the Truth are lost in false pride, and deeply out of tune with Reality
How many a generation have We destroyed before them! They (the earlier generations) prayed to Us when it was too late for them to escape
And people deem it strange that a person from among themselves should have come to warn them! And the sppressors of the Truth say, "This one is but a lying magician
Has he converted all deities into one single God? This is indeed a strange thing
And the leaders among them egged them on, "Go and persevere with your deities. This (what Muhammad is propounding) is indeed a thing designed
We have not heard of this in any recent society! This is nothing but fabrication
Is it upon him — from amongst us all — that the divine Scripture has been sent down!?" Nay! It is My Scripture that they doubt. Nay! They have not tasted the punishment I give
Or, do they have the treasures of your Lord's Mercy — the Lord Omnipotent, the Bestower of Grace
Or, do they possess the absolute sovereignty over the heavens and the earth and all that is in between!? Let them then ascend in vehicles
The confederate forces are bound to suffer defeat there
Before them, Noah's people, and the tribe of AAad, and Pharaoh of the many tent-pegs (i.e. with means and power), denied the Truth
And so did the tribe of Thamood, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the wood [Midian]: those were the peoples allied against the Truth
Not one among them but denied the Messengers. So they deserved My penalty
And these people (of this age) need wait for no more than one single blast (to be annihilated)
And they (the polytheists) say (mockingly), "Our Lord! Hasten on to us our share before the Day of Reckoning
Bear patiently what they (the polytheists) say, and remember Our devotee David, a man of strength. He was indeed of those who always turned to Us
We did indeed cause the mountains to join him (David) in extolling Our Glory at sunset and at sunrise
And the birds in their assemblies: they all would always turn to Him
And We strengthened his (David's) kingdom, and bestowed upon him wisdom and decisiveness in speech
And has the information of the litigants come to your knowledge when they climbed over the walls of (King David's) private chamber

When they confronted David, he shrank back in fear of them. They said, "Fear not! We are two litigants. One of us has wronged the other. So judge between us with justice, and deviate not from what is right, and show both of us the right path
This man here is my brother. He has ninety-nine ewes, whereas I have one ewe. And he asks me to hand over to him even the one I have. And he prevailed over me in the discourse we had

David said (to the complainant), "He has certainly wronged you by demanding that your ewe be added to his ewes! And indeed do many associates — except those who believe in Allah and do righteous deeds — wrong one another; but how few are those exceptions!" And David at once realized that We had tested him (by presenting to him the case of the ewes)! And so he asked his Lord to forgive him, and bowed down, and turned to Him in repentance.h
And We forgave him (David) that [the impropriety that he had committed]. And, indeed, he will certainly be among those near to us — the best place to return to

O David! We have indeed made you a vicegerent on earth. Establish, then, a just rule among the people, and follow not vain desire, lest it lead you astray from Allah's Path. Those who go astray from Allah's Path shall indeed suffer severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning
AND We have not created the heaven and the earth and all that is in between in vain. That is what those who suppress the Truth think. Woe then from the Fire unto all those who suppress the Truth
Would We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like those who spread corruption on the earth!? Would We treat those who are Allah-fearing like those that are wicked
Blessed is the Book We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad,] so that people may ponder over its Verses, and that those who are endowed with insight may pass on their understanding to others
And We bestowed Solomon — an excellent devotee — [as a son] to David. He would indeed always turn to Us
As, towards the close of day, well-bred horses were brought before him (Solomon)

He (Solomon) said, "I have indeed come to love the good things in life as these remind me of my Lord (Who has created them)!" And when they (the horses) were out of sight under the veil of darkness (of the night)
(Solomon ordered,) "Bring them (the horses) back to me!" And then he would [lovingly] stroke their legs and their necks
And We did certainly put Solomon on trial by placing upon his throne a [lifeless] body; and thereupon he turned in repentance to Us
He (Solomon) prayed, "O my Lord! Forgive me my sins, and bestow upon me a kingdom which may not suit anyone after me. You are indeed the bestower of gifts
We then made the wind subservient to him, so that it blew gently at his behest in the direction he willed
And (We made) the devils (work for him) in every kind of construction activity and in diving
And there were others too (who worked for him while) linked together in fetters
[And We told him,] "This is Our special Grant; whether you help others with it or not, no account will be taken
And, indeed, he (Solomon) will certainly be among those near to us — the best place to return to
And recall when Our devotee Job prayed to his Lord, "The Satan has indeed afflicted me with illness and suffering
[He was told,] "Stamp your foot!" [Water springs out from the ground.] "This is cool water to wash with and to drink
And We restored to him his family and as many more with them, as an act of grace from Us, and as a source of inspiration to all who are endowed with insight

[And We told him,] "Now take a handful of herbs and strike therewith, and you shall not break your oath!" We did indeed find him patient in adversity — an excellent devotee, who would always turn to Us
And recall Our servants Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, who were all endowed with inner strength and vision
We did indeed purify them by means of the purity of the remembrance of the life to come
And they were certainly indeed, in Our sight, among the selected best of humankind
And recall Ishmael and Elisha, and Zulkifl : every one of them was among the best of humankind

This [Qur'aan] is a Reminder/Narrative [of all that leads mankind to Paradise and all that leads them to Hell]. And, certainly indeed, the most beauteous of all goals awaits those who are pious and Allah-fearing
The goals are gardens of perpetual bliss with gates kept open for them [the pious and Allah-fearing]
They will be comfortable and at ease therein, frequently calling for fruits and drinks
And they will have with them companions of modest gaze
This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning
This, certainly indeed, shall be Our inexhaustible provision
This [provision would of course be there as promised!] And, certainly indeed, the most evil of all goals awaits those who transgress the bounds of what is right
Hell! They will suffer therein. And how vile a resting-place
This, [then, is for them.] So let them taste it: boiling water (to drink) and a pus-like thing (to eat)
And other torments in pairs of similar nature [— similar to those mentioned in the preceding Verse]
This crowd of people who went headlong with you into sin — no welcome to them either! They shall indeed suffer the Fire
They [the seduced] will say [to the seducers], "Nay, but it is you who are not welcome! You have brought this upon us: and it is a vile state to be in
They will say, "Our Lord! Increase the punishment in the Fire twofold for those who brought this upon us
And they will say, "How come we do not see men whom we counted among the evil
We used to hold them in ridicule! Or is it that our eyes have missed them
That, indeed, will in truth be the mutual wrangling among the people of the Fire
Say [O Muhammad], "I am only a warner! And there is none worthy of worship other than Allah, the One and Only, the Almighty
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between, the Omnipotent, the Ultimate Forgiver
Say: "This is a Message of the greatest importance
[And] you turn away from it
I could have had no knowledge of the angels up there when they argued [against the creation of man]
[I could have no knowledge of it] if it had not been revealed to me [by Allah's permission.] I am but a plain warner
When your Lord said to the angels, "I am indeed about to create a human being out of clay
And when I have completed his form and breathed into him of My spirit, lie down before him in prostration
The angels then prostrated all of them together
[All] except Iblees, who became arrogant, and [thus] became one of those who suppress the Truth
Allah said, "O Iblees! What has prevented you from prostrating before what I have created with My hands? Are you proud or are you of those who think of themselves as high and mighty
Iblees replied, "I am better than he. You have created me out of fire [energy], and You have created him out of clay [matter]
Allah said, "Get out from here; for, indeed, you are expelled
And My curse shall be on you till the Judgment Day
Iblees said, "My Lord! Give me respite then till the Day of Resurrection
Allah Ta'ala said, "So shall you indeed be among those given respite
For a period of time the duration of which is fixed
Iblees said, "Then I swear by Your Honour that I shall certainly seduce them all
All except those subjects of Yours who are sincerely devoted to You
Allah Ta'ala said, "The Truth, then — and in Truth do I state
Certainly will I fill Hell with you and with all those who shall follow you among them
Say [O Prophet], "I ask of you no reward for this [Qur'aan]. And I am not pretentious
This [Qur'aan] is nothing but that which all human beings need to constantly refer to for rightful decisions and actions in their respective worlds
And you will certainly come to know its [Qur'aan's] Message [of the greatest importance] after some time
Revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Omnipotent, the Wise
We have revealed the Book to you [Prophet Muhammad] in Truth, indeed! Worship Allah, then, consecrating your lifestyle exclusively for Him

Is it not for Allah that the pure way of life is!? And those who have taken awliya besides Allah (say), "We worship them not but that they may bring us nearer to Allah." Allah will indeed decide among them concerning what they differ in. Allah does indeed not guide anyone who is a lying suppressor of the Truth
Had Allah wanted to have a son, He could have chosen anyone He willed out of those whom He created. Glorified is He! He is Allah: the One and Only, the Almighty

He created the heavens and the earth; and it was His privilege to create them. He wraps the day over the night and wraps the night over the day. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each to run its course until an appointed time. Is He not the Omnipotent, the Ultimate Forgiver

He (Allah) created you from a single being (Adam), and from that single being He made its mate. And He sent down for you eight cattle in pairs.ah He creates you in your mothersԠwombs, giving you one form after another inside three layers of darkness. That is Allah, your Lord. His is the sovereignty over all things. There is none worthy of worship other than Him. So what has made you turn away

If you suppress the Truth, then indeed Allah stands in no need of you. And He likes not that His subjects should suppress the Truth. And if you are grateful, He likes that for you. None shall bear anotherճ burden. Then to your Lord is your return and He will tell you what you had been doing. He is indeed well aware of what lies hidden in your minds

When any affliction affects man, he cries out to his Lord, turning to Him alone. Then when his Lord bestows His favour upon him, he forgets what he had cried out to Him for before, and sets up rivals to Allah that they may lead others astray from His Path. Say, (O Prophet), "Enjoy your suppression of the Truth for a while. Indeed, you will be among the inmates of the Fire

Or [take the example of] one who remembers Allah assiduously during parts of the night, prostrating and standing, fears the Hereafter, and seeks His Lord's mercy [and] ask, "Are those who know [like that one] equal to those who do not know?" Only those endowed with insight take heed

Say, "O my fellow subjects of Allah who believe, fear your Lord! A good reward awaits those who are good in this world. And Allah's earth is spacious. Indeed those who persevere shall be granted their reward without measure beyond what is due to them
Say, "I am indeed commanded to worship Allah, consecrating my lifestyle exclusively to Him
And I am commanded to be the first of those who surrender to Him
Say, "I do indeed fear the punishment of a dreadful Day if I disobey my Lord
Say, "Allah shall I worship, consecrating my lifestyle exclusively to Him

You worship whomsoever you please, then, apart from Him." Say, "Those, indeed, shall be the losers who will have lost their own selves and their kith and kin on the Day of Resurrection! Is that not obviously the real loss
For them, sheets of fire above them and sheets beneath them! This is what Allah warns His subjects against. "Fear me then, O you subjects of Mine
And those who eschew worshipping false gods and return penitently to Allah — good news for them! (O Prophet!) Give good news to My subjects
Those who pay heed to the Word [Qur'aan] and follow the the good guidance thereof. Those are the ones whom Allah has guided. And those are the ones endowed with insight
What about the one on whom the sentence of punishment is decreed — can you save the one already in the Fire
But for those who fear their Lord there shall be chambers built over chambers beneath which rivers flow. Allahճ promise — and never does Allah fail to fulfill His promise

Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky, then made it flow on earth as resources of water, and then with it He brings out vegetation of various hues. Then this vegetation withers, and you see it turn yellow, and then He reduces it to rubble? Indeed there is a lesson in this for those endowed with insight

Is one then whose head Allah has opened for Islam and who is guided by the light from his Lord (be likened to) those — woe to them — whose minds are hardened against any remembrance of Allah. Those are the ones who have obviously gone astray

Allah has sent down the best hadeeth [Qur'aan], a Book with oft-repeated passages resembling one another. Thereat shiver the skins of those that fear their Lord! And then their skins and their minds become receptive to Allahճ remembrance. That is Allahճ Guidance! He guides therewith whosoever He wills. And one whom Allah lets go astray has none to guide him

How about the one who has to face the severe punishment on the Day of Resurrection? Wrong-doers [like that one] shall be told, "Taste what you earned." acwe. Kaththaba allatheena min qablihim faatahumu alAAathabu min haythu la yashAAuroona
The peoples that lived before them denied the Truth. Then the punishment came upon them from where they knew not
And Allah made them taste disgrace in the life of this world, and certainly the punishment of the Hereafter will be much more grievous. If only they knew
And We have certainly quoted for mankind from every kind of situations [they may face] in this Qurաn for them to remember and relate from
An Arabic Qurաn, without crookedness, for them to take heed from
Allah quotes an example: a man shared by several contending masters, and another submitting to one man. Can the two be alike? All praise to Allah! But most of them know not
You (Prophet Muhammad) are mortal and so are they
Then [after death] all of you will be contesting before your Lord on the Day of Resurrection
